page.title: 04The Queen Anne Pub.
page.content: The earliest mention of the pub is 1825, but the actual date has not been found. The site of the Inn was known as{"Cock Clod"}and it was for fighting. If a man wanted to fight, he would go to this plot of land and stand there, challenging the whole town. If his challenge was not accepted, then he would become the champion of Cock Clod. In 1835, the Inn was a {Magistrates' Office.} Offenders were put in the cellar, which today retains the appearance of a prison. A tunnel leading from the cellar to the other side of the Market place, has been bricked up. In the 1850's the Inn was used as a recruiting office for the {Army,}where they were encouraged to drink too much,and when drunk, they were taken into the cellar and "recruited" into the Army.
